Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that is growing well with enough water and light, showing clear characteristics of health such as upright stems and green leaves.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well due to a lack of water, possibly depicted with drooping stems or wilting leaves.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well because it does not have enough light, potentially showing smaller or pale leaves.
The student can use their drawings to suggest plants need water to live and grow, perhaps with arrows or labels indicating water necessity.
The student can use their drawings to suggest plants need light to live and grow, possibly using the sun symbolically with light rays.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to consistently identify subtle differences between a plant lacking water and a plant lacking light, sometimes interchanging their symptoms (e.g., wilting might be used incorrectly for lack of light).
The student might sometimes forget to label one of the essential elements, such as water or sunlight, reducing clarity in how these resources affect plant health.
